captions.text: -Hey.

I'm Mindy with Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

And this evening, we
are going to show you
another no-heat curl tutorial.

And we're calling this
one headband curls.

So again, it's going to
not have any heat, which

means no damage to
your hair, whatsoever,
which is fantabulous.

And the other nice
thing about this one

is it's one you can do in the
evening before you go to bed.

Sleep on it, wake
up the next morning,

and you have great
curls and you're
ready to go out the door.

You don't have to
spend a lot of time
in the morning getting ready.

So the first thing you're
going to need for this one
is a headband.

Now, when you're looking for
a headband for this hairdo,

try to find one that's
preferably made out

of a soft cotton or
some soft material.

You can see that she has
it resting on her forehead.

And with her sleeping
with it in overnight,

if it has grippies on
it or it's plastic,

it can just sink into
their skin and bother them.

Anyway, so just get
a cotton headband.
They'll like it a lot better.

So if you have bangs like she
does, I have just taken it

and put it under her bangs
so that her bangs stay out

of the curls for the night and
she can just style those again
in the morning.

If you don't have bangs,
don't worry about it.

Go ahead and set the
headband on your forehead.

And you'll notice
that I have set

the headband
underneath her bangs,

but on top of the
back of her hair.

So it's just going to go
right on top of the hair.

Now, I find that it's helpful
to spritz the hair just ever so
slightly with water.

Remember that you
don't want to make

it so wet it won't
dry overnight.

So just a little,
tiny bit of water.

Then you're going to
take a section of hair

and you're just going
to pick up that headband

and wrap it through
the headband down.

And then you're going to combine
it with a little bit more hair.

So now you've combined that
first section and a second.

And you're just going
to do the same thing.

Lift up the headband,
pull it through.

And now I'm going to give it a
tug just so that that hair sits

as close to each
other as they can.

She has a lot of
hair and so I tend

to run out of
headband before hair.

So again, take it,
pull it through,
and try to keep it tugged.
Add some more hair.

Take it, wrap it,
pull it through.

Can you turn your head
this way a little bit?
OK.

I think I turned
you the wrong way.
This way.
There you go.

And this is definitely one that
you can do on yourself as well

as on a daughter or a sister
or something like that.

I've done this one
on myself before.
It's really pretty easy.

So you're going to
continue wrapping
till you get to the center back.

And then you're just going
to let that sit for a second.

And I'm going to go ahead and
go to the other side, which

will be more challenging
for you guys to see.

But rest assured, I am
just doing the same thing

again-- picking up
hair and adding it in.
So we love curls.
This is a good one.
Pick it up, wrap it.

The smaller sections
that you have,

you're going to just
make the curls tighter.

And when you get to the
end-- I've got one more.
Turn this way just a little bit.
Thank you.
OK.
Pull those through.

Now you're going
to take both parts

and you're just
going to continue

to wrap-- see what I mean
about running out of headband

before I run out of hair--
until you run out of it ends.
I've got one more, I think.
Yep.

And make sure it's all in
there the way you want it.
OK.
And turn forward.

I've actually seen
people, believe it or not,

just that leave their hair
like this during the day.

They'll leave it
a little wetter,

wrap it up over the headband
like that, go to school,

wear it around the grocery
store or wherever they're going.

And then if they have a
nice date or a dance recital

or something that
night, then they just

take it out that night or
even sleep in it and take it

out the next morning and
it becomes a second day do.

So we're going to leave
her hair in overnight

and we'll show you
what the curls look
like tomorrow morning.
Hey.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles

and we're going to
show you this morning

the second half
of headband curls.

So we showed you last
night how to set it up so

your daughter could
sleep on her curls
or you can sleep on your curls.

And this is what it
looks like this morning.

You can tell that she's
definitely slept on it.

It's kind of a mess and a
little bit scary looking.

We're going to get
it all fixed up.

So what you're
going to do is just

go to the back where you
tucked in those last pieces

and start just very gently
unwinding the curls,

similar to the way
that you wound them

in in the first place, just
gently tugging them out
of the headband.
OK.
And we'll go do this side now.

And you can see
the curl already.

And then just remove
the headband altogether.
And there you have curls.

Now at this point, you can
do many different things.

I'm going to go ahead and just
very lightly brush the curls,

and especially the
top to just kind

of smooth in where
her bedhead was.
OK.

And you can leave
it just like that.

You can see she's got
really soft, pretty curls.

Or if you want,
you can do a style

at this point-- one of
our favorite things to do.
Thank you.

And then it's kind of fun to
just take chunks of the curl

and bobby pin them here
and there over the rubber

band, which is going to
leave you with a really soft
looking top part, like so.
And kind of [? fits ?] curls.

And then just go ahead and place
the curls where you want them.

And then of course, we'd have
to style her bangs, which
we haven't done this morning.

Within a matter of
minutes this morning,

we have this beautiful
head full of curls
that you could wear anywhere.
And we did it with no heat.
Turn around and say bye.
-Bye.

title: Headband Curls | Easy No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles

It's bad to wash your hair everyday. So maybe wash your hair the day before

still in your hair.

may help someone :)﻿

comments.author: alana durrant

comments.text:
Mine usually last all day, even without the spray! I sleep with it in the 
headband after I have washed and airdried my hair, and tie it in a scarf (I 
toss and turn alot). I have sprayed it and it stayed for about two days, 
although the curls turned into more of a wavy look the second morning. I 
use a thin hairband... And I highly reccomend this method! I have tried 
bantu knots, and cocoon curls as shown by this channel and they have not 
worked for me.
comments.author: Cynthia Walker
